Articles.Content:
i see in other peoples games they have trees I on the other hand do not??? ??? ??? huh?

please can someone tell me how

I like oxygen
Demo users don\'t have trees. In full version, you must enable \'terrain scatters\' or something like that.
The full version only has the trees. KSP cost so much less than, lets say, XBOX 360 games, and KSP is still so fun!

Trees sold separately.* Your parents have to put it together.

* Kerbal Treesâ„¢ expansion explosion pack also includes new terrain engine, more parts, lander legs, advanced mods, persistence, Easter eggs, and much, much more!
Trees and Mun rocks are off by default in 0.14.4, to enable them go to the Graphics tab in Settings and change the marked area as shown.

Trees and Mun rocks are off by default in 0.14.4, to enable them go to the Graphics tab in Settings and change the marked area as shown.

I turned this option on and still no trees, am I missing something? (v.14.4)

Increase the density value to max, and fly around Kerbin/the Mun for a bit. You\'ll see them soon enough. They aren\'t everywhere, and they appear in odd formations comprised of large squares of them all bunched together, as seen from around 200m-1km above the ground (I know they stop rendering at a certain distance, but I forget what it is...).

Trees have been removed near the launchpad to prevent lag, have you looked at the other side of the lake near the KSC? You need to be low enough for them to show, either chuck a rocket over there or drive over with the cart.

If you find trees don\'t forget to take a pic
I will admit I have not explored the planet since I have enabled them, I guess I assumed they would be near the launch pad. I will explore the planet more tonight. I am still a noob at this game.
Have fun exploring, see if you can find the other KSC and the monoliths
I have found a few monoliths around the planet and the moon, but I haven\'s seen any other KSC\'s.
There is one other that I know of, but I have always overshot when trying to get there, it\'s not easy to reach as it is surrounded by mountains.
Can you point it out on a map?

I can\'t on that map no, but this might help : http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=10511.msg159057#msg159057

Or this maybe : http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=2671.msg160957#msg160957
